meanings.definition: To remove a belt or seatbelt.
meanings.sent1: She quickly unbelted before getting out of the car.
meanings.sent2: Remember to unbelt yourself before exiting the vehicle.
meanings.sent3: He tried to unbelt in a hurry but got tangled up in the seatbelt.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unbelt himself from the chair effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: As the roller coaster stopped, everyone unbelted simultaneously, eager to get off.

meanings.definition: Not wearing a belt or seatbelt.
meanings.sent1: The unbelt passengers were reminded to buckle up for safety.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stay safe and not be unbelt while driving.
meanings.sent3: The unbelt man's pants kept slipping down without any support.
meanings.sent4: The unbelt jacket flapped in the wind as he rode his bike.
meanings.sent5: The unbelt child looked uncomfortable without the proper safety gear.
